summary.overview: Lecture: L9 - Pendulum, Circular, Harmonic motion. This lecture covers the following key concepts: - Animation typically involves interpolation, keyframe and easing. - Harmonic typically involves oscillation, frequency and amplitude. - Rotation typically involves quaternion, euler angles and axis-angle. - Numerical Values is an important concept in this lecture. Students should be able to explain these concepts and apply them to simple problems and examples.

GAME2016 Mathematical Foundation of Game Design and Animation

Analyzing  Pendulum Motion
GAME2016 Mathematical Foundation of Game Design and Animation
[Page 18]
Principles of Pendulum Motion
▪Oscillation Dynamics
▪Pendulum motion is an example of 
simple harmonic motion
▪The restoring force is proportional to 
the displacement
▪This leads to predictable oscillations 
that can be modeled mathematically
▪Energy Conservation
▪The pendulum's motion illustrates 
the conversion between potential 
and kinetic energy
▪Maximum potential energy at the 
highest points
▪Maximum kinetic energy at the 
lowest point
